business.headline: New insurance rules: Will claim settlements improve for policyholders?The new insurance laws strengthen oversight and enforcement. In this special report, IndiaToday.in examines whether that will actually improve claim settlements for policyholders.

Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today?At around 9:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 147.50 points to 25,963.30.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

How aluminium is changing the job story in India's mineral-rich statesIndustry estimates cited by the Aluminium Association of India show that the sector has already generated over eight lakh jobs and supports 4,000 SMEs in its downstream ecosystem.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing today: Is GMP pointing to gains for investors?The ICICI Prudential AMC IPO saw very strong demand during its three-day bidding period. The issue was subscribed 39.17 times overall.

Your SIP stayed at Rs 5,000 over the years. How not increasing it 10% cost you lakhsYour salary rose, expenses changed, but your SIP remained at Rs 5,000. Over time, this small choice can quietly cost you several lakhs in missed wealth. Let's understand how.

entertainment.headline: Keep the tricolor flying high: Parineeti Chopra hosts champion Harmanpreet Kaur Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha hosted Indian women's cricket team captain Harmanpreet Kaur at their Mumbai home, celebrating her achievements and humility.

After 43 years, Bhojpuri classic Nadiya Ke Paar to return on the big screen The 1982 Bhojpuri classic Nadiya Ke Paar is returning to the big screen after 43 years with a special screening in Patna to reconnect Bihar's youth with their cultural roots.

Breakdown 1975 review: The chaos that created New Hollywood's daring peak Morgan Neville's 'Breakdown: 1975', vividly traces how the chaos of Vietnam, Watergate, and the rise of the Reagan era reshaped American cinema. Here's our review.

Randeep Hooda's wife Lin Laishram talks about pregnancy after suffering miscarriage Lin Laishram opened up about her pregnancy with Randeep Hooda, revealing how the actor is lovingly preparing for fatherhood. The soon-to-be mother also shared that the couple went through a miscarriage earlier this year and are now embracing this phase with gratitude and joy.

B Praak and wife welcome baby boy after losing newborn in 2022 B Praak and his wife Meera have announced the birth of their second son, describing the event as a spiritual rebirth following the loss of their newborn in 2022. The couple shared the news on Instagram.

Radhika Apte recalls uncomfortable on-set demand during South film shoot Radhika Apte praised South Indian cinema for its strong storytelling while recalling an uncomfortable early experience of being the only woman on set.

Sunny, Bobby Deol remember Dharmendra after Ikkis final trailer: My precious papa Sunny Deol and Bobby Deol shared heartfelt tributes to their late father Dharmendra as the final trailer of Ikkis was unveiled online.

Cinema remembers the brave: Aditya Dhar reacts to Sandeep Vanga's Dhurandhar praise Aditya Dhar responded to Sandeep Reddy Vanga's glowing praise for Dhurandhar, calling it a meaningful validation of his filmmaking journey.

Korean couple Kim Woo-bin, Shin Min-a marry in Seoul after 10 years. First pic out Korean actors Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-a got married at a private event in Seoul. Their agency shared the first picture from the intimate wedding.

Limbachiya and sons: Bharti-Haarsh announce arrival of baby boy in new video Comedian Bharti Singh and writer-husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa announced the arrival of their baby boy with a video on Saturday. This came following Bharti's hospitalisation due to a medical emergency.

Carries a masculine spine: Sandeep Vanga calls Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar powerful Director Sandeep Reddy Vanga shared his thoughts on Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', commending Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's performances. The Bollywood action film has received notable attention for its depiction of violence and the strength of its cast.

Raj Khosla and Mera Gaon Mera Desh: The forgotten hero and his epic cinema As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Mera Gaon Mera Desh, the blueprint that inspired dacoit westerns in Hindi cinema. Like its director Raj Khosla, the film, unfortunately, was never celebrated.

Conan O'Brien stopped 911 call during Nick–Rob Reiner fight at party: Report Rob and Michele Reiner were found dead at their Los Angeles home hours after leaving a holiday party hosted by Conan O'Brien. As per the latest reports, there was a public dispute between Rob and his son Nick, and how Conan O'Brien helped in de-escalating the matter.

Aryan Khan wins Best Debut Director for Ba***ds: Like my father, I love awards Aryan Khan received the Best Debutant Director Of The Year award for his Netflix series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. His mother, Gauri Khan reacted to the win with a post on X.

Dhurandhar box office Day 15: Ranveer's film crosses Rs 730 crore worldwide Ranveer Singh's latest release, Dhurandhar, continues to receive tremendous response from fans across the world. The film has surpassed Rs 730 crore globally and shows no signs of slowing down.

South box office 2025: Malayalam peaks, Tamil and Telugu struggle, Kannada falters South Indian cinema in 2025 showed clear divides with Malayalam films leading in content and Tamil industry facing challenges. The shift signals audiences favour quality storytelling, and star power alone no longer guarantees success.

Malayalam legend Sreenivasan dies at 69 after long illness Veteran actor Sreenivasan died at the age of 69, leaving behind a significant legacy in the Malayalam film industry. His work as an actor, writer, and filmmaker shaped the course of Malayalam cinema for nearly five decades.

general news.headline: PM bulldozed SHANTI Bill to restore peace with his 'friend' Trump: CongressCongress's Jairam Ramesh claimed Trump signing the US National Defence Authorization Act exposed the real reason behind what he described as the "bulldozing" of the SHANTI Bill through Parliament.

Shubman Gill dropped, Ishan Kishan picked as BCCI announces T20 World Cup squadShubman Gill has been dropped as India named Axar Patel vice-captain in their squad for next year's T20 World Cup, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka. Ishan Kishan has also been recalled following his standout performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final.

Mob rule in Bangladesh very concerning: Shashi Tharoor after Hindu man's lynchingCongress MP Shashi Tharoor warned that rising mob violence, attacks on media and intolerance in Bangladesh threaten democracy, press freedom and regional stability, urging a return to democratic normalcy ahead of the February 2026 polls.

This private factory wants to make one new space rocket every monthThis immersive story follows a full day spent inside the high-security facility where engineers, technicians, and scientists are racing against time to prepare Vikram-I, the startup's first orbital launch vehicle, for its upcoming space mission.

Why Osman Hadi has been buried beside Bangladesh national poet Kazi Nazrul IslamAnti-India radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi was buried beside the national poet of Bangladesh, Kazi Nazrul Islam, in Dhaka University. The decision was taken after requests from the office of Muhammad Yunus and the Jamaat Shibir-run Dhaka University students' body. However, Hadi's Inqilab Mancha said it was the leader's family's wish. But, many in Bangladesh see the move as a means to play with history, politics, and the meaning of legacy.

When brilliance becomes a burden: The Suryakumar Yadav conundrumA genius in group matches but goes missing in action during knockouts, Suryakumar Yadav is at a crossroads when it comes to his T20I career. With the T20 World Cup 2026 just around the corner, can SKY strip away everything except the simple mandate to bat with the fearlessness that defined his rise.

Who'll bring mad murderers to justice? Taslima Nasreen on Hindu man's lynchingDipu Chandra Das, a Hindu man, was lynched in Bangladesh's Mymensingh amid widespread violence in Bangladesh following the killing of a prominent anti-India radical leader.

Bharat Taxi will run like Amul does, what is this cooperative modelBharat Taxi is attempting to become the "Amul of ride-hailing" by returning power to the drivers taking on the heavyweights like Uber, Ola, and Rapido. By adopting a zero-commission, member-owned model, Bharat Taxi promises to transform the gig economy from a profit-seeking corporate engine into a sustainable, driver-centric cooperative. India Today Tech takes a closer look.

'Be back after thrashing him': Flier recounts ordeal with Air India Express pilotSpeaking to India Today TV, Ankit Dewan said the confrontation began at a security checkpoint when the pilot, identified as Captain Virender, objected to his presence and made derogatory remarks.

PM Modi inaugurates India's first nature-themed airport terminal in GuwahatiBuilt at a cost of Rs 4,000 crore, the terminal is the country's first nature-themed airport facility and is expected to handle over 13 million passengers annually, making it the largest in the northeastern region.

Mohanlal breaks down while paying tribute to Sreenivasan, videos go viralMohanlal, along with Sathyan Anthikad, paid his last respects to veteran actor-filmmaker Sreenivasan at Ernakulam Town Hall, with emotional visuals of the actor going viral.

Live: Mob marches towards Bangladesh parliament after Osman Hadi's funeralBangladesh Protests Live Updates: Bangladesh will hold the funeral of the radical, anti-India youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi today under heightened security after his death sparked unrest across the country. The interim government said the funeral prayer will take place at the South Plaza of the National Parliament Building at 2 pm. Authorities also announced there will be no public viewing of the body and appealed to people to offer prayers while maintaining order. The body arrived in Dhaka from Singapore on Friday, following which the interim government urged citizens to resist violence by what it described as "fringe elements". In a late Thursday televised address, Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus promised swift justice in the killing, asserting that "no leniency will be shown" to those responsible. Despite the appeal, several areas witnessed attacks and vandalism on Thursday night, including stone-pelting at the residence of the Assistant Indian High Commissioner in Chattogram, shortly after Yunus confirmed Hadi's death. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Watch: Isro tests parachutes responsible for Gaganyaan Mission landingThe trials were conducted on December 18-19, 2025, at the Rail Track Rocket Sled (RTRS) facility of DRDO's Terminal Ballistics Research Laboratory (TBRL) in Chandigarh.

Dhurandhar's Rs 1,000-crore box office march, and the new Hindi cinema orderDhurandhar eyes the Rs 1,000 crore global club after nearing Rs 500 crore nett in India. What the film's historic run means for Hindi cinema, Ranveer Singh, and Bollywood's evolving box office rules.

How empires, elites & Europeans enshrined an exogenous entityDravida began life as a Sanskritic whisper — yet by the first millennium CE, Tamilakam's saints, scholars, sovereigns and subjects had turned it into a roar. Rajas and Prajas alike gave the word currency, credibility and even a circular halo. Tamil ploughed its lone, luminous furrow, but Dravida lingered like an uninvited uncle who refused to leave the public wedding feast.

Kings who remained absent from school narratives for decades will finally be heard, with their stories and legacies brought back into the classroom. The book also highlights India's new growth engines and explains how technology is reshaping the country's economic journey. Here's a detailed analysis of what the revised textbook offers.

Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup snub shows lack of clarity: Dinesh Karthik Shubman Gill's snub from the T20 World Cup is a case of lack of clarity, according to Dinesh Karthik after the squad for the ICC event was announced on Saturday, December 20. Gill and Jitesh Sharma was dropped from the side despite playing the South Africa series.

Ishan Kishan's Bhagavad Gita-guided grind earns him T20 World Cup recall Ishan Kishan's return to India's 2026 T20 World Cup squad marks a comeback built on resilience, domestic grind and a newfound sense of maturity after setbacks, scrutiny and spiritual reflection.

Watch: Ishan Kishan's first reaction to T20 World Cup selection Ishan Kishan returns to the Indian cricket team after a two-year hiatus. His domestic centuries and leadership helped him secure selection for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026.

Hope Shubman Gill takes T20 World Cup snub in right spirit: Sunil Gavaskar Sunil Gavaskar is hoping that Shubman Gill will take his T20 World Cup snub in the right spirit. Gill was dropped from the side despite being the vice-captain of the team after his patchy run of form with the bat.

What wrong did Jitesh Sharma do? Fans left fuming after T20 World Cup snub Shubman Gill's omission grabbed attention, but Jitesh Sharma's exclusion has confused fans even more. Fresh off a strong IPL run with RCB, many believed he had done enough to earn a World Cup spot.

BCCI Announces T20 World Cup Squad: Shubman Gill Dropped from T20 World Cup 2026 SquadIn a significant development for Indian cricket, BCCI Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar announced the squad for the T20 World Cup 2026, confirming the exclusion of star batter Shubman Gill. Addressing the media, Agarkar explained that the decision was driven by team 'combinations' and the preference for a wicketkeeper-batter at the top of the order. Consequently, Axar Patel has been reappointed as the vice-captain. Agarkar stated, 'Someone has to miss out when you pick 15. And unfortunately, it's Gill at this point.' The squad also sees the inclusion of Rinku Singh and the return of Ishan Kishan, while Suryakumar Yadav continues to lead the side. The Chief Selector emphasized that the management wanted flexibility and depth, highlighting the role of all-rounders and wrist spinners in the upcoming tournament.

Why was Gill axed from T20 World Cup squad? Selector Ajit Agarkar explainsIndia's T20 World Cup 2026 squad announcement delivered a major surprise with Shubman Gill left out of the 15-member squad. However, the chief selector clarified that the decision was not a reflection of Gill's calibre.

Ishan Kishan has also been recalled following his standout performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final.

Australia leave England on the mat in Adelaide Test, edge closer to retaining AshesAshes: Australia are just four wickets away from winning the third Test at the Adelaide Oval and retaining the urn. England still need 228 runs with only four wickets in hand, and will have to produce something extraordinary to avoid defeat.

Kavem Hodge leads West Indies' strong fightback with classy hundred on Day 3Kavem Hodge led a determined West Indies fightback on day three, reaching his second Test hundred as the visitors closed at 381 for 6, still 194 runs behind New Zealand's first-innings total.

Mohammed Shami to lead Bengal's pace attack in Vijay Hazare TrophyExperienced pacer Mohammed Shami has been named in Bengal's squad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy following a strong domestic season. Shami, who has not featured for India recently, brings his impressive form to Bengal's campaign as the team prepares to compete in Elite Group B.

Anthony Joshua hands boxing reality check to Jake Paul with a 6th round KOAnthony Joshua delivered a brutal reminder of boxing's pecking order by stopping Jake Paul in Miami. The sixth-round knockout exposed the gap between elite heavyweight pedigree and crossover hype.

Shubman Gill should continue to open, Sanju Samson can bat at no 3: UthappaFormer India cricketer Robin Uthappa has backed Shubman Gill to continue as India's T20I opener despite poor form. He suggests Sanju Samson should bat at No 3 to strengthen the lineup ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Suryakumar needs just one good innings to reaffirm T20I calibre: TilakSuryakumar Yadav's prolonged lean patch has become India's lone T20 concern before a home World Cup. Teammate Tilak Varma believes one defining innings is enough to restore the skipper's fear factor.

T20 World Cup squad Highlights: Shubman Gill snub a real surprise, says Sunil GavaskarTeam India Squad Announcement Highlights: The BCCI has announced the 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup 2026. Star batter Shubman Gill has been dropped, and Axar Patel has been announced as vice captain. Ishan Kishan has also made a return to team India after two years.

Not Bumrah, Pandya was the difference between two teams: South Africa coachSouth Africa head coach Shukri Conrad has showered praise on Hardik Pandya following his terrific all-round performance in the T20I series. Pandya was adjudged Player of the Match following his breathtaking innings of 63 (25).

When Hardik Pandya lit up Ahmedabad with Sir Viv-esque swaggerHardik Pandya's swagger-lit masterclass against South Africa had echoes of Sir Vivian Richards, according to Robin Uthappa. The former India batter believes such intimidation-driven cricket defines India's ideal T20 template going forward.

Mohamed Salah is his own man, apologised to Liverpool dressing room: Teammate revealsCurtis Jones revealed Mohamed Salah apologised to Liverpool teammates after controversy. The midfielder said the dressing room stayed united, insisting Salah's comments reflected elite competitiveness rather than any intent to destabilise Arne Slot's squad.

Rohit Sharma set to miss first few Vijay Hazare Trophy matches. Here's whyRohit Sharma will miss Mumbai's opening Vijay Hazare Trophy matches as selectors prioritise testing emerging talent this season. The call has dampened fan excitement, especially with senior stars returning to domestic cricket spotlight nationwide anticipation.

Gill out, firepower In: Why India must unleash Sanjushek in T20IsThe Indian team found their attacking mojo once again and it was no surprise that reinstallation of Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma at the top led to the change. While Shubman Gill remains a fine player, India needs to replace finesse with firepower if they want to retain their T20 World Cup crown.

India to announce T20 World Cup squad today. Will selectors back out-of-form Shubman Gill?Shubman Gill's role in the squad will be the main focus as India will announce their side for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 on Saturday, December 20. With the team also mos well-set, will the selectors throw a few curveballs at the fans with some bold choices?

Watch: Hardik applies ice pack to cameraman hit by his six in Ahmedabad T20IIndia vs South Africa: One of Hardik Pandya's five monstrous sixes struck a cameraman at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. The all-rounder went over to check on him immediately after the final delivery of the match was bowled.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
